National Museums Liverpool E-learning and Development Platform,Contract,"National Museums Liverpool",Awarded,2020-01-16T12:53:13Z,"National Museums Liverpool E-learning and Development Platform","Bidders are asked to submit a formal tender for the ""NML E-learning and development platform"".
NML is a group of 8 museums and galleries and 5 non-public sites located across Merseyside with over 700 staff and over 200 volunteers.
NML is a complex organisation, which has gone through a sustained period of change.
NML is looking for an online e-learning training platform that would inform and contribute towards the personal and career development of its employees.
The e-learning platform should cover all aspects of training needs of NML employees including (but not limited to):
The e-learning platform should allow the creation of a course-completed certificate for personnel training records.
The e-learning platform must produce reporting and monitoring statistics of e-learning training completed and accessed by NML employees.
The e-learning platform must notify employees directly of courses invited to complete / courses outstanding for completion.
The e-learning platform should be web based and accessible operate on mobile devices e.g. laptops, Surface Pros.

The e-learning platform needs to support our own course content including policies and procedures.",,,"North West","72000000 80000000 ","Ian Lindsay",Ian.lindsay@liverpoolmuseums.org.uk,"127 Dale Street",,LIVERPOOL,L22JH,England,,,"Appendix A - Form of Tender.doc Appendix B - NML Procurement Protocol(1).docx NML E-learning and development platform Tender Specification.docx NML E-learning and development platform Tender Q&As.docx ",,,09/01/2020,28/02/2020,05/12/2019,YES,"National Museums Liverpool E-learning and Development Platform",Yes,No,No,Products,0,,08/01/2020,24000,"[Me Learning Ltd|The Barn

PROJECT - 00004551 - AWARD,Contract,"Coventry - Solihull - Warwickshire",Awarded,2017-08-16T14:17:49Z,"COV - Tender for the supply of an E-Learning platform - AWARD","The Council is re-tendering its contract for an E-Learning platform. The platform will support the delivery of the Council's Workforce Strategy with the intention of delivering a better learner experience to help the Council achieve better participation.

The Council is seeking to procure a modern e-learning platform that facilitates interactive and participative e-learning as well as allowing remote access in line with the Council's corporate initiative of agile working. We are seeking a solution that comprises an e-learning platform that has the functionality to host content purchased from a range of suppliers, and for us to be able to develop and manage our own content.
The new Contract will be open to other Local Authorities in the region as named in the OJEU notice and Invitation to Tender document.
Estimated Contract Value:  £200,000

Contract Start and Expiry: Tuesday 2nd January 2018 to 31st December 2020 with the option to extend for 2 x 1 year periods at the agreement of both parties.",,"CV1 2PW","West Midlands","80420000 ","Michael Duffy",michael.duffy@coventry.gov.uk,"New Union Street",Coventry,Coventry,"CV1 2PW","United Kingdom","024 7683 3539",,,,,02/01/2018,31/12/2020,05/06/2017,NO,,No,No,No,Services,0,200000,15/08/2017,0,"[Me Learning Ltd|Basepoint Business Centre, Ropetackle, Shoreham-by-Sea, West Sussex, United Kingdom, BN43 5EG|||No|No]","Nick Richards",02/01/2018,31/12/2020,"Open ",
